title: Soft Systems Thinking-Based Language Communication Strategies for Higher Education Innovation

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level specialized knowledge and problem-solving skills, academic writing and presentation experience, proficiency in basic communication skills (listening, speaking, reading, writing)
context.additional_context: Formative assessment in smartphone-based learning environments emphasizes practical tasks—utilizing text-based collaboration tools and evaluating grammatical/lexical accuracy during feedback processes.

learning_goals: Learners create one rich picture visually representing perspectives of at least three stakeholder groups (e.g., citizens, government, partner organizations) based on public project cases. They achieve an "Excellent" rating in at least four of five peer/lecturer evaluation criteria (Clarity, Comprehensiveness, Creativity, Expressiveness, Logical Consistency).

Acquire the ability to develop and apply a multi-layered activity model for problem situation analysis—specifically strengthening the capacity to analyze verbal and nonverbal communication barriers among stakeholders.

Establish practical problem-solving strategies in higher education through structured dialogues based on Soft Systems Methodology (SSM), including assessments of technical term accuracy and contextual appropriateness during discussions.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
